messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:02): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, hey did you think about a test format?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:02): it would be great to have something like the HTML stuff
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:02): input, output, and input contains errors
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:03): and I guess we should have some shortcuts for input, so that you e.g. do not need to provide the signature, or cue time information
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:03): (in such a scenario they would just be pre-filled)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:11): lol
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:11): webrtc fork uses respec
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:11): so, of the pages which nightly telemetry users have loaded, 2% has had mutation listeners :/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:12): with the silly <dl> way of defining methods
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:12): of course it is possible that gmail or some such has mutation listeners
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:12): and every new message loads a new page or something...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:13): is a different fragment identifier a new page?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:14): in this case? this is not based on urls, but effectively js windows
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:15): different pages get a new window
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:15): (expect in certain cases with about:blank)
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:15): except
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): ah, I think Gmail is pretty much all one window
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): oh, or maybe not
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:16): it is using iframes everywhere
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): yeah, forgot about that, ignore me
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:17): I should probably count usage per domain
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:17): gotta catch a train
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:17): yeah
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:20): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, do you have any suggestions for what to do about the "separating cues" issue?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:24): I wonder how wildly different Opera's <track> implementation is compared to mine
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:38): http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=155295
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:38): Refactoring the Web Interface
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:38): John R. Douceur, Jon Howell, Bryan Parno, and Michael Walfish
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:38): http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/155295/SOSP2011Poster.pdf and http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/155295/SOSP2011PosterAbstract.pdf
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:44): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: i'm thinking either tolerating whitespace between cues or starting a new cue when seeing a timing line
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:45): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167: looks like they want to bring not only one but many proprietary stacks to web
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:46): yup looks like this
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:46): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: where timing line is a line containing -->. if you want --> in data, you'd need to escape it
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:46): or I didn't understand and it also seems like an interop nightmare
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:47): and also the HTTP layer is placed in a strange place in their diagram.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:47): it certainly looks like interop nightmare
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:47): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: another thing that might be common is to not have two blank lines in "header", so the first cue gets eaten
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:47): oh, hmm, http is nowhere near network
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:48): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, I would also prefer to have timing lines always start new cues and require escaping to allow "-->" inside cues
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:49): this post is a lot more fun http://sebleedelisle.com/2011/09/pixelphones-a-huge-display-made-with-smart-phones/
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:49): websocket inside
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (13:49): people in research centers can propose many silly things. I certainly did at my time :)
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:49): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, second best would be to strip whitespace when collecting a line, but meh
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (13:50): using the light sequences for localizing the phones is genius
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:54): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: WDYT about cue in header?
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:54): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, you mean directly following WEBVTT?
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:55): if we make a timing line always start a new cue I don't see why we couldn't make that work as well
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:55): we want this because 1.3% contains an error currently?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:55): of SRT files, no less...
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:55): however, that particular error you are actually quite likely to notice, since it's the first cue
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:55): the current format seems much easier to read
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:56): and we have a validator of sorts now :)
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:56): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, except a validator doesn't complain about cues in cues, right?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:56): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: i don't see any reason the error would be less common in VTT
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:57): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342, it could warn
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (13:57): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, but it's valid per the syntax right now
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:57): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: "easy to read" is irrelevant since we're not suggesting changing what valid files look like
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:58): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342, yeah making --> in cues invalid might be a good idea
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:59): making it invalid and start a new cue might be an even better idea :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:59): since it's what the author intended and what the user wants
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:59): and what SRT does
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:00): euh okay...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:03): SRT also does , and not .
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:03): still not sure why we don't do SRT if that's what everyone wants
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:03): can't really both argue we need a new format but UAs are also going to support SRT
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:06): SRT parsers support both , and .
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:07): personally i think we should have specified and extended SRT, but that's not where we're at
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:08): anyway, i'm not doing this to end up with SRT. i'm doing this to get error handling in VTT better based on what errors people do in SRT
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:09): e.g. it turned out that errors in timestamps was pretty rare, so i'm not proposing to make that more lax after researching that
f69d55844584e567962289a5226442b4 (14:21): http://kizu.github.com/Castle-of-Sinister-Sorcerers/
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:42): anybody know when the content model for the <dt> element was changed to allow flow content?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:42): (instead of just phrasing content)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:44): seems it was some time after May 25
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:48): http://html5.org/tools/web-apps-tracker?from=6617&to=6618
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:51): hmm. <b\n> gets dropped but <b \n> is parsed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:52): yeah white space rules in the parser are funky
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): I filed a bug on that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): as they do not handle FF either
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): while the timing/setting algorithm does
